alert.note: Alert for Big Island East; Big Island North; Kauai East; Kipahulu; Koolau Windward; Molokai Southeast; Molokai Windward; Olomana; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Warning issued December 18 at 3:31PM HST until December 19 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF WARNING FOR THE EAST FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR THE NORTH FACING SHORES OF KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI MAUI AND THE BIG ISLAND... .Surf along exposed east facing shores remains above the warning threshold as a large long-period northeast (40 degrees) swell moves through the area. The northeast swell will also keep surf at exposed north facing shores above the advisory threshold. Surf should drop below the warning threshold late tonight. ...HIGH SURF WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Surf 14 to 18 feet along east facing shores, and 10 to 15 feet along north facing shores. * WHERE...North and east facing shores of Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, Maui, and Big Island. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Very High...Expect ocean water surging and sweeping across beaches, coastal benches, and lava flows creating the potential for impacts to coastal properties and infrastructure, including roadways. Powerful longshore and rip currents will be present at most beaches. Large breaking waves and strong currents may impact harbor entrances and channels causing challenging boat handling.
info.instruction: Stay away from the shoreline along the affected coasts. Be prepared for road closures. Postpone entering or leaving channels affected by the high surf until the surf subsides.
